title: (x) Heinemann Chocolatier logo - hand lettered {Patricia}
content:
Does this is handwriting or can I find a digitized version?   
   
 ![chocolatier, found in brussels, belgium](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208230305im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/35260.jpg)   
   
thank you

 [‹ Ann Taylor logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208230305/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4633 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Why Difference Matters - Gridnik {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208230305/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4650 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Gregory Cadars

comments.content: I can't even read it! My guess is handlettering because of the flourish at the very end and the slight variations on the angles and curves.

maybe it is onomatopoeia   
the sound of chocolate melting in your mouth   
   
   
oh.. yes.. i confess...   
my name is Jack... i am a chocoholic!
It says "Heinemann". They've been making cakes since 1932, so I'm pretty sure this is hand lettered.

_\> It says "Heinemann"._   
   
Well you obviously have to know that to be able to read it...

BTW I second Patricia's theory. Oh and Jack come to Belgium:   
we positively have the best. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208230305im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
